intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius standleyi, commonly known as the Standley's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces yellow to orange ray florets surrounded by a dense cluster of disk florets. Hieracium standleyi is often found in altitudes ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters.
